title: My great grandfather moved from Italy to Chicago in 1918, and lived there briefly before returning home. Where can I find records of his immigration or U.S presence? - Quora
tags: Immigration to the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: He most likely entered the country through Ellis Island in New York City. Passenger Arrival Lists Other than that, you can try the Census bureau to check the Chicago census records if he was there in 1920. 1920 U.S. Federal Census Records Hope this helps. Good luck.
